story:
What we are trying to do

Our vision is to provide an open keypad with display, that is accessed over the world wide web. We believe in innovative design, that challenges accepted standards.

With that said, we saw an opportunity to potentially revolutionize the delivery of web and network based services. This applies across a number of industries.  

The market in this particular field of technologies offers multiple solutions where the key pad and it’s operation is locked together. With POE Internet Keypad we chose to go in different direction. The result has been a challenging project that has landed us on IndieGoGo for support so that we may take this idea to the next level!

 

Con todo gusto podemos recibir mensajes en español. Sólo requerimos 24 horas para dar respuesta.

What We Need & What You Get

 The goal is to raise $16,500

Take the POE Internet Access Key Pad in to production

  • Order parts for the first production units - $7,400
  • Assemble and test - $3,800
  • Packaging, hardware etc  - $5,300

Total  $16,500 

 

The perks!

Your support is greatly appreciated and you will be mentioned in our recognition page

 

The Impact

The POE Internet key pad is a particular interesting project for developers and IT professionals.  It offers an awesome solution.

This device communicates over TCP/IP and allows any IT manager to implement their own system. The POE is a single cable connection to enable communication to any network or internet.

The 2 x 16 character display allows for a reply from the host application to guide the user

This open platform enables easy bi-directional communication as this unit is a mini terminal.  The user can be guided or given other information that a keypad  with no display cannot.

Con todo gusto podemos recibir mensajes en español. Sólo requerimos 24 horas para dar respuesta

Safety -  Restrict access to hazardous areas

  • Limit use of machines
  • Use only by authorized persons at approved times

  Service Industry - Internet or network delivery of

  • Tickets
  • Coupons
  • Receipts

 Machine minding

  • The operator can enter codes to report status
  • Codes can indicate if in service, faulty or other condition
  • Managers can thus monitor activity in remote locations

Access control

  • Many access control devices are restricted, the POE, TCP/IP gives  the user great flexibility
  • The keypad can communicate directly with the host and does not need a local control panel  
  • User can enter one or more ID numbers
  • The application can then act on the data entered
  • The unit can be remotley configuerd 

Delivery of web based services

  • print management
  • time and attendance
  • score keeping

 

Subsidiary Device

  • A serial device can be controlled via the keypad
  • We supply the combination to your requirements; the host application sends instructions over the network or internet and the keypad passes them on to the subsidiary device
  • This could be a magnetic card or proximity card reader, a receipt printer, or other serial communicating device

Technical

  • 10 base T operating speed
  • IEE  802.a detecting
  • There are a set of Commands for LCD control
  • Multiple keypad tester Utility available – checks for errors when setting up multiple units on one network

 Rapid Integration

  • Rapid integration will be made possible with an app
  • The app will ease comunications directly with a remote data base
  • The app will offer a limited internal data base allowing enrollment etc.

 

WHO WE ARE?

We are a dedicated group of professionals led by Stuart Thorn.   Stuart is CEO of Electrone Americas a technology company, that has provided solutions utilized in many industries form Cash Machines to catering. Formerly Stuart was non-executive Chairman of Acrastyle Ltd, a company supplying control and protection equipment to the power supply industry, and Chief Executive of Newgate Trust plc,.

On of the significant development projects of Stuart J Thorn was an adaptation of an analog handset for a digital, USB application.

Consultant Design and Systems Engineer, Mohamed Mohamed, has a wide range of electronic expertise, previously with Galaxy systems, and a graduate of FAU in both Computer Engineering and Computer Science and a member of IEEE and ACM. 

In addition, our Marketing manager is Caitlin Gallaher. Caitlin specializes in Social Media Marketing, Sponsored Advertising and WordPress Website Design. 

Elmira Khudieva Managed as Executive assistant an overseas office of All Ukrainian Energy Company, and was in charge of the 84 feet motor yacht Spellbound, handling the $100,000 refit of the vessel and other related projects.

Technical Assistant Chris Toussaint, has experience in small assembly electrical testing, and programming.

 

Con todo gusto podemos recibir mensajes en español. Sólo requerimos 24 horas para dar respuesta.

 

What else have we done?

Digital Timer - a timer intended to control a timed cycle on a mains current appliance, such as the DEFROST CYCLE on a refridgerator.  The PCB is fully digital and detects power outage or cut.  The PCB monitors time and at the predetermined time it swithes to the alternate routine for a measured time period and then switches back.  In the event of a loss of power, this until will save the point in the cycle of power loss so when power is restored, it can resume from the same point in the cycle that power was lost.

 

 

Industrial Data Logger - this will monitor the operation and performance of an electical device running up to 440 volts at 50 or 60 Hz.   It will display volts/amps/watts togehter with temp; the logger can be configured to accept multiple inputs and each logger is a network device to allow data to the be comunicated to an application collecting the data.  The data can then be consolidated in to reports.   A flow meter has already been implimented and automated test subject data capture via bar code and RF reader.

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help us share our campaign by clicking on the share too!

Spread the word! Twitter, Face book, LinkedIn, tell you friends.

 

You are welcome to contact us through our website: www.poeinternetkeypad.com 

 

Like us on face book: https://www.facebook.com/#/stuart.thorn.568

Like us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/pub/accesscontrol-internetkeypad/72/1/89a

Our team is truly grateful for any support you can offer.

Con todo gusto podemos recibir mensajes en español. Sólo requerimos 24 horas para dar respuesta.

 

A little philosophy

 

A continuous flow of new products, ideas, people and businesses, are all critical to keeping a nation’s economy vibrant. 

 

Traditional venture capital and Bank lending have retreated from micro projects in the developed world; but these projects are the individual building blocks so important to the forward movement of the economy as a whole.  Crowd funding exercises the power of the internet to enable and accelerate a new universe of projects.

 

We here are all very excited to become active in crowd funding.

 

Thank you !

story:
What the heck is a smudgease?

smudgease is an iPad screen cleaner made of micro suede with a beaded string attached. A pretty simple idea really.

What made you think of it? 

I was always losing that little piece of cloth to clean my screen. So I figured like a book mark, I'd attach a string with some decorative beads to a piece of micro suede (the best material to clean your screen) so that when I closed the flap it would stay inside. Voila! smudgease was born! 

What else do I need to know about smudgease?

smudgease are currently available in three colors: black, blue and gray. Each color comes with its own unique combination of hand-crafted beads. 

Every smudgease will be made in Los Angeles, CA, USA! USA! USA!

smudgease uses fair trade beads hand-crafted by a community of women in Uganda.

 

 

What are you going to do with the money you get from indiegogo?

I will employ two people to make and package the first 100 smudgease. And I will send those smudgease off into the world to folks who can help spread the word: magazine writers, bloggers and people who write about new, cool stuff for iPads.

 

 

 

And i will design a website for retail buyers and consumers so they can read about smudgease story and be able to buy them.  FYI: i am an award winning designer. Feel free to check out some of my work: EAMER MARKETING + DESIGN. 

Extra! Extra! Read all about it!

If i get extra money i'll get more smudgease in the hands of more buyers, more writers, more bloggers -- and maybe even some hollywood celebs! 

Oh, and one more thing - swag - the perfect corporate gift.

We can create corporate smudgease too! A business can send us their logo and we will print and sew it on smudgease in the color fabric of their choosing. 

My manufacturing and retail strategy: You can't eat an elephant in one bite.

I am not actually going to eat an elephant. That would be wrong. I am however going to start small. I am going to have smudgease made close by so i can stay actively involved in every step of production and packaging.

I will establish retail and media contacts in my own backyard. Thankfully, living in LA, I have a very big back yard. I will go out and speak to the owners of local boutiques and shops, pound the pavement, give out complimentary samples, make available 'point of sale' counter cards and brochures. And create as many opportunities to meet with people in person - face to face. Get smudgease in people's hands. To see smudgease is to love smudgease.

 

Here's the wind up... 

 

... and here's the pitch!

We would love to have you join the smudgease project in any way you can:a reward of our gratitude for $6, a reward of a 'soon-to-be' classic black smudgease for $18, all three: black, blue and gray for $54, or 10 corporate smudgease with your own logo sewn onto the fabric for $200.

story:
Kickstarter Project:  CalcCases.com - A Smartphone Calculator Case

Hi everyone.  I have an exciting new project that I believe will be well received by the millions of smartphone users out there.  I started a new company called CalcCases.com and over the last year, I have developed a working prototype that I show in my main video above.  I created this project because I am seeking funding for an improved second prototype and cases for more smartphone models.    

What is a Smartphone Calculator Case?

Everyone runs into a situation when they need to do a quick calculation. Whether you are in a store trying to figure out a discounted price, at home trying to add up bills, at work figuring up your overtime pay or hundreds of other places. This is why I created CalcCases.com. CalcCases give you great protection for your Smartphone but it also gives you a working calculator with some cool functions right on the back of your case! Just flip your phone over and start using the calculator. It is that fast and easy.

Yes you could use an app to do the calculation, but when you are in a hurry, it is a pain to wake up your Smartphone, unlock the screen, find the right calculator app and finally do the calculation. Besides, when you use your phone you are also using your precious battery minutes.

I always carry my phone around with me and I am constantly spending good money to buy simple everyday phone cases. I thought it would be so much easier to have a working calculator on that back of my case that I have with me at all times. Once I had my own Calculator Case, I found that I use it all the time in multiple situations and I now cannot live without it.

Since I go out to restaurants often with friends, I thought it would be very beneficial to have a split bill calculator function built into my CalcCases. It is very simple to add in a tip to the total bill and split the bill into several parties. You can also add or subtract percentages easily with just a few keystrokes and there is a Previous button so you can go back and make sure you added up all the numbers into a total.

I believe I have created a Smartphone calculator case that is retro styled, very useful, easy to use and handy.

How it started

I thought of the idea when I was working on the road.While traveling, I did not always have a handheld calculator with me. I constantly needed to calculate figures, dimensions, capacities and engineering units and I mainly used my laptop accessory calculator or calculator app on my phone. The problem with both methods was I had to unlock my phone or laptop, pull up the right calculator and use battery power while I was working through the numbers. I kept thinking that it would be better to have a calculator right on my iPhone case. I could just flip it over and use it any time I needed. The case could have it’s own battery and I could actually feel the keys when I used it. I paid enough for plain old phone cases that had no functionality so I thought there has to be a better way. At that point in time, CalcCases.com was born.

I decided to design and create a prototype in order to see if it was possible. I created a hand sketched drawing in a hotel room to begin the process. See my sketch below.

First Sketch

In order to protect my idea, I decided to create a patent application. I downloaded all the forms from the US Patent Office on line and read all the instructions. It is about as fun as doing taxes. Once I figured out the process I submitted for a patent for my design with multiple pictures and descriptions of functionality. I waited for about 3 months and received a patent pending number and an estimate of when I would have a patent hearing. Of course being the government, they told me it would be at least another year before I would have my patent hearing. I did however obtain a patent pending number that would protect my idea and design.

After sketching the product and submitting for a patent, I created non-working prototypes on different cases. Below is a picture of one of my first non-working prototypes:

I then looked for a company that could help me manufacture a working prototype.This was very difficult. I sent letters to different companies in the US, I contacted existing smart phone case companies, I did research on calculator companies but I did not get any replies or responses. I kept searching online for different resources and friends in the electronics business and I found someone that would make me a prototype for under $20,000.  I spent weeks working with them on integrated circuit functions and calculator programming and then on case designs and materials.

Finally after several months work with the manufacturer (and thousands of dollars of my own money), we came up with the following 3D picture of the first Calculator Case:

It looked slim and had some great functions and I really liked the retro styling. We worked for a few more months on form, fit, material and calculations and then I ordered the first working prototype.

Prototype Features

 This first prototype is shown below in several pictures and videos.

First Prototype

We worked a long time on calculation flowcharts and programming keys. We wanted to make it fast and easy to add and subtract percentages so if you were in a store, you could quickly calculate 30% off your purchase.  We believe we have created fast and easy calculations and a very handy Split Bill Functions that everyone can use at their favorite restaurant.  This allows you to easily add a tip and split your bill with your friends.   Here are two videos that show the prototype features:

Feature Video 1

http://youtu.be/YM13uW-aKa4

Feature Video 2

http://youtu.be/NfBol1X4ewc

 

 There is no other case on the market like it and no case manufacturer had a working calculator. I showed the prototype to my friends and family and they all wanted one for their iPhone. Many people I ran into had Samsung Galaxy S III phones and they wanted one too. When I took the prototype on the road, I used it all the time. Anytime I needed to do a quick calculation, I just flipped my phone over and calculated the numbers without using my phone battery at all. It was fast and convenient.  Every time I had it up to my ear and was talking on the phone, the calculator would show on the outside and people would ask me where I got my cell phone calculator. If my phone was flipped over and I was using the calculator and the phone started ringing, people would tell me my calculator was ringing. LOL. It really grabbed attention and people really loved it. That is why I believe my product will be a very successful.

I have a manufacturing facility that is in the process of making a second generation prototype that has slightly raised keys for a better keypad feel, an improved fit and finish, a thinner design and better durability for everyday use.  I need help with funding that second prototype. I also need funding assistance to be able to create more smart phone case models for Apple, Samsung, HTC and Nokia.Each case model cost thousands of dollars to create. I will not be able to compete with larger case makers if I don’t offer more smart phone case models. I also need funding for the production run. The Manufacturer is asking for tens of thousands to start production and another 20K for setting the moulds. I plan to offer three colors of each model in Black, Blue and Pink.  You will be able to pick the color you desire.  Below provides you an idea of all the tasks that have already been completed and the tasks that still need to be done for this product to be successful. Thank you all for your support.

REWARDS

Once we obtain the funding for the second prototype and the final production, I am planning to open up an Amazon Store with your choice of Calculator Cases.  The Amazon Store will allow you to order your rewards easily and securely and if you have Amazon Prime, your shipping will be free. 

 

Process for a Successful CalcCases.com Project:

1.Sketch out my design – COMPLETED

2.Create a non-working prototype for sizing, fit and finish - COMPLETED

3.Design CalcCases.com and apply for Patent- COMPLETED

4.Find a Manufacturer that will help create a prototype - COMPLETED

5.Create Calculator functions and features – COMPLETED

6.Design an integrated circuit board-COMPLETED

7.Create First Working Prototype Model– COMPLETED

8.Testing and Improvement Order to Manufacturer – COMPLETED

9.Start Second Prototype Design –Started March 2013

10.Kickstarter Project to fund first production run - April 2013

11.Test Second Prototype for feature fit and finish. -May 2013

12.Develop Different Calculator Case models for other phones – May 2013

13.First Production Run of Calculator Cases for iPhone 5 - June 2013

14.Shipment to CalcCases.com – June and July 2013

15.Send out iPhone 5 CalcCases to all my Early Adopters and Premium Backers - June/July 2013

16.Send out Samsung Galaxy and iPhone 4S CalcCases to all Galaxy and iPhone 4/4S Backers - August/September 2013

17.Develop more smart phone cases and models for other popular phones like HTC and Nokia – September/October 2013

It looked slim and had some great functions and I really liked the retro styling. We worked for a few more months on form, fit, material and calculations and then I ordered the first working prototype.
Prototype Features
 This first prototype is shown below in several pictures and videos.

First Prototype


We worked a long time on calculation flowcharts and programming keys. We wanted to make it fast and easy to add and subtract percentages so if you were in a store, you could quickly calculate 30% off your purchase.  We believe we have created fast and easy calculations and a very handy Split Bill Functions that everyone can use at their favorite restaurant.  This allows you to easily add a tip and split your bill with your friends.   Here are two videos that show the prototype features:
Feature Video 1
http://youtu.be/YM13uW-aKa4
Feature Video 2
http://youtu.be/NfBol1X4ewc
 
 There is no other case on the market like it and no case manufacturer had a working calculator. I showed the prototype to my friends and family and they all wanted one for their iPhone. Many people I ran into had Samsung Galaxy S III phones and they wanted one too. When I took the prototype on the road, I used it all the time. Anytime I needed to do a quick calculation, I just flipped my phone over and calculated the numbers without using my phone battery at all. It was fast and convenient.  Every time I had it up to my ear and was talking on the phone, the calculator would show on the outside and people would ask me where I got my cell phone calculator. If my phone was flipped over and I was using the calculator and the phone started ringing, people would tell me my calculator was ringing. LOL. It really grabbed attention and people really loved it. That is why I believe my product will be a very successful.
I have a manufacturing facility that is in the process of making a second generation prototype that has slightly raised keys for a better keypad feel, an improved fit and finish, a thinner design and better durability for everyday use.  I need help with funding that second prototype. I also need funding assistance to be able to create more smart phone case models for Apple, Samsung, HTC and Nokia.Each case model cost thousands of dollars to create. I will not be able to compete with larger case makers if I don’t offer more smart phone case models. I also need funding for the production run. The Manufacturer is asking for tens of thousands to start production and another 20K for setting the moulds. I plan to offer three colors of each model in Black, Blue and Pink.  You will be able to pick the color you desire.  Below provides you an idea of all the tasks that have already been completed and the tasks that still need to be done for this product to be successful. Thank you all for your support.
REWARDS
Once we obtain the funding for the second prototype and the final production, I am planning to open up an Amazon Store with your choice of Calculator Cases.  The Amazon Store will allow you to order your rewards easily and securely and if you have Amazon Prime, your shipping will be free. 
 
Process for a Successful CalcCases.com Project:
1.Sketch out my design – COMPLETED
2.Create a non-working prototype for sizing, fit and finish - COMPLETED
3.Design CalcCases.com and apply for Patent- COMPLETED
4.Find a Manufacturer that will help create a prototype - COMPLETED
5.Create Calculator functions and features – COMPLETED
6.Design an integrated circuit board-COMPLETED
7.Create First Working Prototype Model– COMPLETED
8.Testing and Improvement Order to Manufacturer – COMPLETED
9.Start Second Prototype Design –Started March 2013
10.Kickstarter Project to fund first production run - April 2013
11.Test Second Prototype for feature fit and finish. -May 2013
12.Develop Different Calculator Case models for other phones – May 2013
13.First Production Run of Calculator Cases for iPhone 5 - June 2013
14.Shipment to CalcCases.com – June and July 2013
15.Send out iPhone 5 CalcCases to all my Early Adopters and Premium Backers - June/July 2013
16.Send out Samsung Galaxy and iPhone 4S CalcCases to all Galaxy and iPhone 4/4S Backers - August/September 2013
17.Develop more smart phone cases and models for other popular phones like HTC and Nokia – September/October 2013

story:
Short Summary

IOTrain is a simple, small yet brilliant piece of innovation which allows Arduino to have as many digital IOs as you wish. Each module adds 24 IOs to your project and you can cascade multiple such modules to fulfill your project requirements

Who We are

I am Tushar Jambhekar, I own Jambhekar Automation Solutions.We are experts in electronics and PC based Industrial automation. For past 7 years we are in this field and in India we have provided services to companies like Whirlpool, John Deere, Emerson etc.

The Story Behind IOTrain

For quite some time I am working on Arduino. and it is awesome development platform . It simplifies the development a lot.

However when you select a particular Arduino board you are limiting the number of IOs that can be utilized in your project. E.g. UNO is having 14, Leonardo is having 20 whereas ADK has got 54.

If your projects needs more IOs; then things suddenly get quite tough. You might need to

  1. Design custom circuits
  2. Implement complex protocols like SPI, I2C etc.
  3. Spend many days in debugging code.
  4. Struggle to comply with timing constraints.
  5. Spend money on costly equipments to analyze timing characteristics.

And so complexities pile up.

I wanted to eliminate all these complexities once for all.

I believe that developing small projects on Arduino is simple and it should remain simple irrespective of size of project.

Meet IOTrain and Say No To Complexities

IO train is cascadable IO expander which goes well with Ardiuno philosophy. Each IOTrain Module has got 24 digital IOs. and you can cascade as many modules as you want till the time you don’t hit total of 65000 IOs.

Also for interfacing IOTrain to Arduino or compatible board you don’t need to learn much. IOTrain comes with its own open source Arduino library. Library functions are similar to Arduino’s digitalWrite and digitalRead functions

How It Works

Under the hood IO Train uses I2C protocol. During initialization of IOTrain auto detection algorithm in firmware detects the number of modules attached to i2c bus of Arduino. Each module on bus assign itself appropriate channel numbers (e.g. first module takes channel number 0-23, second module occupies 23-47 and so on.). and subsequent commands can use channel number for reading or writing status information on it.

Blink Program with IOTrain

IOTrain is Open Hardware and Open Source

On successful completion we will release the source files of software and hardware on our product site

Compatibility

IOTrain can be used to extend IOs on any Arduino or Arduino compatible board which has got hardware i2c interface. It consumes only two pins on Arduino and in return can happily give back hundreds of IOs.

Technically IO Train can be used by any device which is capable of communicating over i2c. but it will need IOTrain library to be ported for the device.

IOTrain works on 5V logic levels hence level shifter will be required for devices that do not work with 5V levels.(We or working on it and trying to make it work on both 5 and 3.3V levels)

Are you thinking about using IOTrain with Raspberry PI? We feel that its a great idea. and as soon as we hit the project goal we will introduce the stretched goal for porting IOTrain to RaspberryPi. We will also add 3.3V <-> 5V level shifter board required by raspberry pi as a perk

What is Current Status of Project

We have created 5 prototype boards for IOTrain. we have completed the development of firmware and we have also completed the IOTrain Library for Arduino.

By cascading 5 IOTrain modules we have tested it for up to 120 channels of input as well as outputs and it is working great

What Needs To Be Done Yet

Preview of Final smd Board

Double layer PTH PCBs instead of current single layer ones

Our current prototype PCBs are manufactured in house using single layer design. However for final product we will be using double layer PTH PCBs. Design of new PCB is complete but manufacturing will be done immediately after completion of campaign. (Double layer PCBs always perform better than single layer PCBs hence this does not involve any risk)

One more prototype run

Our current prototype is working great however we will be creating one more prototype which will focus on making board compact and sexier.

Validate that IOTrain works for very very high channel counts

Theoretically IOTrain supports up to 65000 channels however we have tested it only up to 120 channels. Upon receiving of funds we will manufacture multiple boards and will test it for at least 1024 channels. (We have already simulated most of the situations like extended lengths of i2c bus etc. but we still need to test with lots and lots of cascaded boards)

Ensure quality of manufactured product using automated test equipment

We want to make sure that each module delivered to our customers is defect free. We are ready to invest time and money required for that. We already have plans for automated test system to test each manufactured module before dispatch.

What We Need and What You Get

We need your support to turn this project into reality. To bring prices down we need to mass produce our modules. So please Support us by picking biggest perk you can. By passionately picking bigger perk you are not only supporting for a cause but you are also receiving back a bigger reward.

Please don't stop yourself just by picking the big perk. you can support the cause in many ways which wont cost you a penny. you can

  • spread the news about IOTrain over social media
  • ask your friends and relatives to support this project
  • if you know journalists ask them to write about IOTrain
  • follow us on twitter @t_jambhekar and #IOTrain
  • re-tweet the #IOTrain tweets
  • let us know about people and projects who can use IOTrain .(we will take efforts to make IOTrain to be a great experience for them)

In return to your support we are responsible not only to you but also to community

For you we will

  • take best of our efforts to deliver your rewards in time if not earlier.
  • provide defect free product and great experience.
  • provide you email support if you face difficulties in using IOTrain.

For Community we will

  • make IOTrain a evolving product
  • support IOTrain users to fair extent (IOTrain is open source so some users may not be our customers)
  • continuously learn through the process and make life of hardware tinkerers easier.
  • create more such products.(we are lined up with other ideas)

Rewards

IOTrain (pin header)

IOTrain (screw term)

How your money will get utilized

  1. To manufacture additional prototype run with double layer PCB
  2. Make large orders for production and bring price down
  3. To build automated test equipment for quality check
  4. Documentation, example codes etc.
  5. Working on half a dozen related ideas we have.

Risks and challenges

As with any project, there are risks and challenges with this project as well. First of all, we’re still not finished with our product. That means some issues may still arise, though unlikely.

Moreover, testing and setting up manufacturing process takes time. unforeseen causes might delay the process to some extent.

As far as prices are concerned we have taken in to account the extra costs to cover manufacturing risks.

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone, my name is Kya and I am from Greensboro, North Carolina.  I have never been a fan of exercising, but after working one of the most stressful jobs there is (I am not kidding we are like number 2 of the most stressful jobs based on lengthy research...lol) A few years ago I decided to start running. It was like a breath of fresh air and such a great stress reliever.

I ran around the neighborhood for a couple of years and then last year stepped outside my comfort zone and ran my first 5k. What an awesome feeling to complete a race, and I ran the whole way fyi (pats self on the back) Well, I have recently decided to run a 10k  and what I realized is that running is a lot better, easier, as a woman, safer, and just more enjoyable when you are doing it with more than one person.

That is when I started looking for running buddies and then running groups around the area. What happened next was, I said" there has to be a better way to find running groups around where a person lives", and that is when I  came up with this idea for   an app to assist in this aspect. This will not be the only thing the app does by the way...lol, there will also be several other cool features that will be added as well that I am really excited to hopefully share in a second fund raising quest...lol! Some of the other features will aid in motivating the running groups and also to hopefully get additional people to run with the running groups, or even form their own.  So, I have the business plan and I have the developers to begin, but I need to rasie some funds to help me get this idea jumpstarted.

What We Need & What You Get

Most of you are probably going ummmm, developing an app costs waaayy more than $2500.00 lady...lol!! I know, the funding I am initially requesting here is to get the legal stuff and protection out of the way. The $2500.00 will be used for:

1.  to incorporate the business,

2.   develop a logo through 99designs.com (which is a really cool concept site where you host a contest to have hundreds of people compete for you to choose their logo, and then you pay them for their idea, kind of paying it forward)

3. Create a website to initiate marketing and buzz for the app

4. Lastly for copyright protection

The Impact

I am really excited about the motivation factor my app will present once it is established. I tend to believe it is a tiny step in helping America get fit, and healthy, and have some fun while doing it. Hey why not?

story:
Hi everyone!

How many times do you put on your headphones and say: "Uh I love this song!"?

Tons of times I guess. But then at the end of the song you listen to an awkward silence... ten seconds... twenty seconds... Is the iPod stuck? Did it crash?

Let's press play in case it paused by mistake. But then thirty seconds of nothing. Shall I press it again?

I don't know maybe this song has an endless intro and I just don't remember, let's skip it..... Same silence, the iPhone is stuck for sure. Or maybe it's because of the volume, I got it! That must be the volume!

Nope. And twenty-five clicks later you are still there trying to figure out what is wrong until you have to get your phone out of the pocket to check. Damn.

It's cold. I don't want to put out my iPod, my hand would freeze. Or maybe it's in the backpack and I already have tons of stuff in my hands...

Are you tired of all this??

Well I am. Every time I walk home I just have four blocks on the subway and sometimes I just can't listen to even one song. And all this because I can’t remember if some songs have long intros, which is human. You should check your phone pulling it out of the pockets; but when you are in cold weather will you feel like undressing again to find your phone somewhere in your pockets?

(I like Pink Floyd, but have you ever tried to go jogging with them?)

 So?

 So what? I am creating an app for that! The goal is to create an app that automatically cuts off the silence before the beginning of the song and permits you to enjoy the music without freaking out every three minutes. How? The app will be created to select the whole library or only certain songs and let your default player to skip the first point and go straight to the point. I am thinking about a simple application that would be sold for less than five dollars. I would pay five dollars, just in case. And I bet you too.

Less than five dollars, eh? How much?

I like to talk straight. These are the prices I had in mind:

-          Free for lite version in AppStore, Android and Cydia (100 songs)

-          3,99 $ for Appstore

-          4,99 $ for Android and Cydia

-          4,99 $ for Google Chrome Store

If you fund the app with any cash offer, you will always have these prices. Never more, but never less.

 

Even one dollar gets all us closer.

 

Why AppStore more than Cydia and Android?

This will be the fist app ever to appear both on AppStore, Amazon, Android Store and Cydia Store. Why AppStore and Cydia together? Let me explain:

Apple has a dedicated mp3 player, the iPod, which cannot be modified by any software. In order to remove the silence automatically to the songs we will have to interact with the iPod app. We don’t want to do anything illegal, so no default player for Apple. We will gift you our player, and as long as you will use it you will enjoy the majesty of our app.

What’s the name of the app again?

Fastmusic. dabu[Fastmusic] to be accurate.

 dabu?

It’s me. I believe in this idea, it’s easy, fast and can save everyone’s time. Even ours.

I am in. What do you need money for if you already have a company?

I am a 24 yo intern, and probably I will go on for a long time like this but I like what I do. And I am fond enough of technology to know that small things make life better. Like this app, less than five dollars for it seems a reasonable price.

The money I would need is for hardwares and softwares, and they will be spent to pay the people I will hire to create the app I am trying to obtain a trademark for. And trademarks cost money too, like internet webpages, developers account and so on.

If a company comes here and steals my idea because I don't have a trademark? Well I can do nothing. Without money there is not much I can do. But I have many ideas. I hope I could use this money to finance also other inventions, mostly using trademarks, which I told you, cost a lot. 

What do I get?

Check the rewards, you’ll be surprised.

Even one dollar gets all us closer.

story:
About the App

SafetyGrid is an exciting new App available for iPhone and iPad that turns your device into a silent panic button.  Much like buttons used in banks or medical call buttons but this button goes where you go and is available when you might need it most!   The concept is quite simple, a big Red Button that when pressed notifies up to 5 of your chosen contacts via SMS, Email, and Automated Telephone Broadcast of your need of assistance.  Not only will it call your contacts, but it also conferences them all together and directs them to a webpage where your estimated location is continually updated during the duration of the alarm.  What really makes this app shine is it's silent operation and it's visual updating of the big red button to indicate the status of the alarm from Sent to Acknowledged for example.   It will also indicate problems if encountered such as Network problems or problems obtaining a location and will continually try to retry.    

For truly advanced safety, you can subscribe to the monitored alarm service which works practically anywhere in the world! The GEOS International Emergency Response Center will attempt to contact you and 2 contacts you provide via telephone.  If you require emergency assistance they will coordinate the services for you.  What's truly impressive is that if there are costs associated with the Search and Rescue operation, you are covered for up to $50,000.00 per incident (twice a year for annual and monthly plans as well).

Our Story


I'm Jim Hankins, the founder and developer of SafetyGrid.  I'm a US Army veteran whom after exiting the service in 1993 have spent the rest of my time in Information Technology positions including supporting some of the worlds largest companies.  On 9/11, I lost a friend and previous coworker who had been working in New York City.  He was struck by debris falling from the sky during the attack.  He collapsed in the streets of New York dropping his phone by side, apparently unable to call for help. We are all products of our experiences in our lives, I am no different.  My experiences have driven me to create this tool with the hopes it will be of service to many throughout the world.




The Impact

SafetyGrid is truly a game changer for personal safety.  Any parent of a teen ager or college student knows the feeling of not knowing if your loved one is safe.  Our aging parents who still live in their own homes, many who travel extensively are also always on our minds.  Even our spouses while they are away from home can be cause for concern.  A recent success story in the news with SafetyGrid highlighted helping a woman outside Houston Texas who was the target of an armed carjacking attempt!  I spoke with the woman's husband who was so very appreciative and thankful and I of course was humbled by the conversation.  Unlike so much out there that we can focus our attention, this project truly can help change lives in more ways than you can imagine.


What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to expand SafetyGrid's visibility in the market place and while we've had local success in the media we need to expand the visibility of this product globally. We are seeking funds to be used for advertising as well as professional translation of our app into multiple languages.  The more languages we can get SafetyGrid translated into, the greater the reach and the more people we can help.  Today SafetyGrid is only in English and only available in the US and Canada for downloading. With your help, we can change this! Finally, and this is the big one for a lot of people.  We are bringing SafetyGrid to the Android platform!  This will require more development work and equipment for testing all of which costs money. 

Thus far we have been completely self funded and all development has been and will continue to be in house, but we truly need your help to get SafetyGrid into as many hands as possible. How many projects can you participate in that actually have the ability to save lives? 


Other Ways You Can Help

Be a cheerleader, involve others, use the sharing tools to post on social media sites, shout it out from the mountain tops!  The people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world are the ones who do, - Apple's "Think Different" commercial, 1997.  Call me crazy but that's exactly what we're doing and with your help, we'll get it done for sure!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

About 85 % of the APP is developed and in Beta test mode. We have been working on this for well over a year and have invested a lot of our personal income into this project. 

The project was developed to bring awareness and Reward to service individuals that strive for excellence. This application will be a service metric tool that will allow establishments and personnel the opportunity to achieve a higher standard of satisfaction for the end user. The end user will be capable of tracking tip expenditure on a daily bases, while at the same time contributing valued feedback 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking funds to completely finish the app testing and also to enhance a couple of the features. So some of the funds will be for development, some for Marketing, and also for completing the Trademark properties for Us, Canada and Europe. The mark has already been accepted in the US by the USPTO, We just need to file a statement of use.

  • We are looking for a total of $50,000.00 to complete the project. $30,000.00 will be for final development of the gateway functions and the establishment data tracking service metrics. We are building for iOS 8 and Lollipop OS 5.0 and up. The other $20,000.00 will be for marketing, lawyer fees and trademark protection in other countries. 

  • As we move along we will have some small perks, at different funding levels.
  • If we do not achieve our entire goal, then we will invest what has been funded into the final development stage.

The Impact

Your contribution will help thousands of individuals that work in the background with low wages and little recognition, A perfect example is that of the room attendant who may have to clean and set up more than 15 rooms a day. This is a simple example of the thousands of service workers that dedicate their lives to making yours better. Think about it. Who else truly does that for you?

  • You will be contributing to the well being and just entitlement for a sector of our community that rarely gets recognized and rewarded.
  • This is as real as it gets. Its about human nature and dignity of ones self, we have the power to make a difference.

Risks & Challenges

Our major challenge will be to get the word out and have this APP in as many iOS and OS phones as possible. We know that the service industry employers as well as employees would like to have more feedback and recognition. So the message must go out. As previously mentioned the App is already in Beta testing, and our commitment to launching is real and tangible. We will get this done.

  • The risk is simple. Not succeding, and for us this is not an option.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Even if you can not contribute, please help us get the word out so that we can contribute to greater good of the service industry workers.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools at your disposal.

story:
We love watching movies, ball games outdoors with our buddies and hate to be tethered to the power outlets, so we created Flicks last year, world's first mobile cordless boombox projector that lets you watch movies for 8 hours unplugged. Now we are after the other major problem when watching movies outdoors: Screen.

It's nearly impossible to find a white surface to project your movies or ball games in the woods or your backyard and we've always hated the fact that we have to drag along those bulky pull-up/pull-down projection screen to the campsite or those inflatable screens that require external power supply to pump the air. So, we invented Magic Screen. World’s first projection screen that pops open from a flat, circular disk to an 80-inch freestanding projection screen in seconds. From now on, you will never have to worry about finding a white surface to project your favorite movies or ball games outside.

Magic Screen works with Flicks and all other projectors in the market. So, there is no reason for not throwing a party this Olympics summer. Let's get ready to party!

Magic Screen is light weight and extremely portable, and it pops open into an 80-inch projection screen and stands on its own in seconds. No assembly required.

Throw and ready in seconds. No assembly required!



We've also designed Magic Screen to be a snap to fold and store when you are done using it. 
Fold and pack in seconds

Magic Screen is so light and portable, you will bring it anywhere you go and you will never have to worry about looking for a white wall to enjoy your movies and ball games with your family and friends on big screen outdoors and indoors.






We've also developed a 25-inch Magic Screen so you can bring along to share that spontaneous and brilliant ideas to your colleagues in Starbucks or wherever you desire.

story:
Let's face it—Desktop Keyboards basically SUCK!

  1. They're uncomfortable...
  2. They're ugly...
  3. They take up too much space!

The eXpress Keyboard Platform fixes these fundamental challenges, and turns Apple's Keyboard and Trackpad into the ultimate, ergonomic keyboard!


Want to free-up more than 50% of your precious desktop real-estate? Do you want to clean-up your desktop workspace and turn it into a Zen-garden-like minimalist masterpiece? Then the BulletTrain eXpress Keyboard Platform is designed and made just for you!!!


Desktop keyboards are designed to be used like this:

The challenge is, this introduces a FALSE ECONOMY OF MOTION. In other words, using the keyboard and trackpad in this way requires you to expend more energy, and causes more discomfort—especially in the long term!!!

Not only is the eXpress the ultimate desktop keyboard, but it's also the ultimate laptop keyboard. The eXpress is the only keyboard solution to bring you the ergonomic experience of the MacBook to your desk or lap, even on the go with you while you navigate keynote presentations for the big meeting! Try doing that with any other keyboard and mouse, or trackpad!

Whatever the task, the express makes doing it an ergonomic dream!!!



Editing video for your next film or TV show? Doing graphics work for print or web? There's no job too big or small for the eXpress!

When it's time to kick back and relax, the eXpress really shines.

With your eXpress on your lap, you can now control your Mac Mini Media Center or Home Theater PC from the comfort of your favorite couch or chair.

The BulletTrain eXpress was first born in San Francisco, California in 2010 out of the desire to create the most ergonomic Desktop, Laptop, iOS and Home Theater keyboard. 


We discovered long ago the ultimate desktop keyboard just happens to be a laptop keyboard, which puts the trackpad front and center while comfortably supporting your palms and wrists.

The new eXpress has been designed to deliver an even more ergonomic experience in a lighter, thinner, sleeker, and more stylish form factor than ever!!!

The name 'eXpress' is a triple entendre for the design intent of the eXpress Keyboard Platform.

  • Be in the EXPRESS-lane of friction-free computing, eXpress TRAIN = economy of motion
  • EXPRESS(ion) of minimalist BEAUTY in your computing workflow, and
  • Your favorite color eXpress is a way to personally EXPRESS yourself in your workspace!

At BulletTrain, we only design and bring to market products we ABSOLUTELY MUST HAVE, and personally CANNOT live without! Friction-Free Products that SIGNIFICANTLY improve your workflow and make your life MUCH better!


[Appearance Model] Ruby Red eXpress Keyboard Platform, SAFE Wallet 6 Plus and Magic Pencil Holder on a Space Gray iPad Pro.


Ever since the Magic Trackpad was first introduced in 2010, Apple users have asked the question—why doesn't the Magic Trackpad work with iPads and iPhones?????

We firmly believe Apple's Trackpad API will be a revolutionary addition to these devices! We aren't alone!!! Intrepid programmers have developed solutions for multitouch input from the Magic Trackpad on jailbroken iPhones and iPads. 

BulletTrain IMPLORES Apple to open up the Apple Trackpad API to iOS devices!!! 

If you agree, you can let Apple know!

Until Apple opens the Trackpad API for iOS, we've designed a beautiful solution to use the eXpress Keyboard Platform and Apple Magic Keyboard with your iPads and iPhones! We call it the BulletTrain eXpress Slate, and it will be available through this campaign!

OPTIONAL: Add a BulletTrain eXpress Slate by adding $12 to your pledge.

  • May 2016 - IndieGogo Launch
  • June 2016 - Tool Building Begins
  • July 2016 - Mold Trials / Modifications
  • Late July 2016 - Testing First Article Production Units
  • August 2016 - First Production
  • Late August 2016 - First Production Shipment

  • Unifies the Keyboard and Trackpad into ONE platform for easier handling!
  • Built-in wrist rests save your hands and wrists from unnecessary strain!
  • Puts the trackpad exactly where it belongs—centered in front of the keyboard—just like on a MacBook!
  • Use the eXpress ANYWHERE!!! On your desktop, lap, standing up!
  • Game-Changing keyboard for your Mac, iOS device, and Home Theater!
  • Easy Installation and Removal!
  • Convenient access to Lightning charging ports and power switches on both the keyboard and trackpad!!!
  • Corrects the False Economy of Motion inherent in using a traditional Keyboard and Trackpad/Mouse, saving your wrists, arms, and shoulders long-term discomfort!!!

We're incredibly excited to bring the eXpress Keyboard Platform to market through this campaign! 

The eXpress Keyboard Platform received critical acclaim and accolades from Apple tech press. This is a preview of how you will feel about the new BulletTrain eXpress!!!

"The eXpress Keyboard and Trackpad Platform looks like it should have been designed and built by Apple themselves!"

-iPhone Life Magazine


"Thankfully Someone Was Listening! The BulletTrain eXpress is the exact keyboard configuration I wanted [...] it’s beautiful, functional, and it is an absolute MUST for anyone who loves their MacBook but also uses an iMac."

-GearDiary


Customers from all over the world love the original eXpress—and agreed it made a huge improvement. This list of customers includes Facebook, Twitter, Google, Apple, as well as the following organizations:

  • Harvard Business School
  • Harvard Medical School
  • Harvard Law School
  • MIT
  • Stanford University
  • U.S. Department of Energy
  • U.S. National Institute of Health
  • U.S. Army, Navy, Air Force, and Marines
  • NASA
  • Adobe
  • Amazon
  • Cisco
  • Craigslist
  • Dropbox
  • eBay
  • Microsoft
  • Spotify
  • 20th
  • Century
  • Fox
  • Paramount Pictures
  • Lucas Arts
  • Zappos
  • Puma
  • Bloomberg
  • National Geographic
  • Hilton Hotels
  • Bosch
  • Boston Scientific
They've all experienced the best keyboard form-factor on Earth—the BulletTrain eXpress! Join the Revolution!!!


Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Will my hands accidentally activate the larger Magic Trackpad 2 when I'm using the Magic Keyboard when installed in the BulletTrain eXpress?

A: No—the Magic Trackpad 2 will not activate by your palm touching the surface!

—————— 

Legal: Patents Pending. Copyright © 2016 BulletTrain. All rights reserved. eXpress Keyboard Platform, SAFE Wallet, and SAFE Stick are trademark of BulletTrain. iMac, Apple Magic Keyboard, Apple Magic Trackpad 2, and MacBook are trademarks of Apple Inc.

Soundtrack: “Awel” by stefsax (ccmixter.org/files/stefsax/7785)

story:
Phase 1:  100+ GB -- Delivery Summer 2016

  Help us prove the CrowdSignals.io concept: a dataset for and funded by the community!  In addition to powering data-driven research, we'll also use our website (http://CrowdSignals.io) to foster communication among researchers, and a greater awareness of the work being done with data from smart devices. 
 
 Here's a summary of what Backers can receive in phase 1:
  • The Data: 100+ GB (over 20K hours!) from 30+ volunteers
  • Ground Truth: 10-50+ hours of precisely labeled activity data
  • Use: use the data for educational, research, or commercial purposes
  • Code: samples for working with the data 
  • App: basic version of our app for use in collecting your own labeled data
  • Educational Materials: slides, docs, and videos for educational purposes
  • Community Connection: present your work on our website and blog
  • Influence: ability to propose and vote on new ground truth labels
  • A hand in shaping Phases 2 and 3: when we collect 100x more data!
As featured in:

    

  • NYT: CrowdSignals Aims to Create a Marketplace for Smartphone Sensor Data
  • KD Nuggets: CrowdSignals.io, Building Big Mobile Social Sensor Dataset 

How to Contribute + Perks

There are several ways to support CrowdSignals.io.
 
1) Direct Contribution: Many people are interested in supporting the project, but do not have any need for the data. In this case the best way to give may be through a direct and (optionally) anonymous contribution. To give in this way:
 
Step 1: scroll down to the bottom of the page and click the "Contribute Now" button.


Step 2: This will take you to a contribution form where you can make a contribution in any amount and choose to remain Anonymous if you care to.  


2) Contribute and Receive a Perk!   This is the option for you if you'd like to receive the data for use in teaching, research, or commercial use.
Simply click on one of the Perk options and complete the form.  Contribute at any of the following levels:


We can also arrange institutional licenses if you want access for everyone at your institution.   Please contact us to discuss!


CrowdSignals.io: Building a Community Dataset

   CrowdSignals.io is organized and run by AlgoSnap, a bootstrapped start-up in Seattle with roots in the research community. The project is advised by top experts in academia and industry. With your support, we will create the largest set of smartphone and smartwatch data available to the community. The dataset will include anonymized place, sensor, social, system, and interaction logs as well as user-provided ground truth labels and survey feedback. The data will be collected from a demographically diverse pool of volunteer Android users across the United States.

   We will not profit from this dataset - all funds raised will contribute directly to the data collection effort, this includes compensation for AlgoSnap staff as well as for volunteers who consent to share their anonymized data. The data will not be sold or otherwise used to generate revenue outside of this crowdfunding campaign. Furthermore, 12-18 months after we share data with Contributors we will make the data available to academic researchers for free.

   We will use best practices in recruiting, on-boarding, and working with volunteers. For volunteers, this means informed consent and the ability to opt-out or delete any data at any time. For Backers, this means an agreement to commit to ethical use of the data (e.g., no onward transfer, no reverse engineering) as well as some transparency regarding how you will use the data.


CrowdSignals.io Community: Advisers and Experts

We've been fortunate to receive feedback and advice from  hundreds of experts in academia and industry. Several have agreed to advise CrowdSignals.io: 
  • Henry Tirri (Aalto University)
  • Deborah Estrin (Cornell)
  • Jason Hong (CMU)
  • Andrew Campbell (Dartmouth).

See more of the community at http://crowdsignals.io


The Data

   We're collecting numerous concurrent data streams and will leverage the increasing prominence of Sensor Hub Technology to capture rich, high-frequency sensor data for long periods of time. 

   See our data types and anonymization doc (pdf) for details, or check out our free data sample: http://crowdsignals.io/sample-dataset.html
-- Note that this data sample is not anonymized.

List of Data Types (includes smartphone and smartwatch):

  • Accelerometer, Gyroscope, Uncalibrated Gyroscope, Magnetometer, Uncalibrated Magnetometer, Heart Rate, Temperature, Light, Pressure, Humidity, Proximity, Bluetooth, GSM, WLAN, Semantic place names and categories (e.g., "Home", "Restaurant - Italian"), Contacts, Call and SMS log Headers, Battery, Connectivity, Networking, App Usage, Camera Usage, Media Consumption, Phone Status, Ringer State, Screen State, Configuration

Smartphones and Smartwatches:
   We're collecting data primarily from smartphones and will include smartwatch data for volunteers that own a smartwatch. If Backers vote to collect Interval Labels (see Ground Truth Labels below) for scripted physical activities with a significant manual component (e.g., washing hands) then we will do our best to ensure that smartwatch data is collected from 30 volunteers.

Security and Anonymization
   All data will be encrypted, securely transmitted, and subject to strong anonymization. In particular, all unique IDs (e.g., contacts, MAC, SSID, Cell ID) will be hashed on device and replaced with a simple identifier (e.g., "Contact 426") in post-processing.  Geo-location data will be mined to extract a log of places visited and then destroyed after volunteers provide semantic labels for each place (e.g., "Italian Restaurant").  App usage logs may be semantically fuzzed. For example, the exact name of an app may be replaced with a descriptive category (e.g., "game").

   This approach to anonymization may limit the utility of the data for some research. However, we feel this level of anonymization is appropriate for a shared dataset.


Ground Truth Labels 

We collect several categories of ground truth from volunteers:

  • Demographic Surveys: basic info such as age range, sex, and education.

  • Place Labels: names for places visited (e.g., "Home", "Italian Restaurant")

  • Contact Labels: relationship to a each contact (e.g., "Spouse", "Co-worker").

  • Interval Labels: precise start and end times that correspond to a particular activity or phenomenon (e.g., "washing hands", "sit-ups", "searching for an Italian restaurant")

  • Point Labels: a volunteer's state at a single point in time (e.g., "happy", "arrived by bus", "eating"). Solicited at random times as in Ecological Momentary Assessment (EMA), or provided at will by volunteers.

Proposed Labels (5/10)

As of 5/10, campaign contributors have proposed the following labels for data collection.  If you have more candidate labels to propose, please send them to us at organizers@crowdsignals.io! In May we'll review together and decide how many (if not all) labels we can capture and include in the dataset.

  • Device Usage: Information seeking behavior (e.g., find an Italian restaurant)
  • Environmental: Indoors / Outdoors, How many people are in current place
  • Wellbeing: Mood, Physical Wellbeing, provided periodically with point labels
  • Physical Activities: Elevator up/down, escalator up/down
  • Daily Life: Eating, sedentary behaviors (e.g., watching TV)
  • Situational: Phone position (e.g., in pocket, in purse, in hand, on table)
  • Transportation: Driving, Parking, Riding public transit

Proposing and Voting on Labels

   Demographic Surveys, Place, and Contact Labels will be collected from all volunteers. A set of Interval and/or Point Labels will also be collected. 

  1. Backers at the $20 and higher levels may propose Labels to be collected.

  2. All Backers $20 and higher will vote to decide which labels will be collected.

  3. AlgoSnap will break tie votes and reserves the right to veto any proposed Label due to privacy, engineering, or safety constraints.

Examples of Other Popular Ground Truth Labels

   The following are examples of popular labels according to recent survey feedback:


Timeline and Plan

   We spent a year developing our software platform and legal framework. We've tested and refined it over the last few months and we're ready for Phase 1 of CrowdSignals.io!  Data will be collected from May through August and will be shared with Backers in Summer 2016.  We'll make the dataset available to academic researchers for free in Summer 2017.

July-August Plan
In July and August we will recruit and collect data from 30 volunteers before sharing collected data with campaign contributors.  More details and updates will be announced to Backers by email and on the CrowdSignals.io blog at:  http://crowdsignals.io/blog/

Use of Funds

   By far the most expensive component of a data collection campaign is the development of a software platform and legal framework - we've already done that! We'll apply funds to the remaining costs:

  1. Paying volunteers: we'll pay volunteers for the data they contribute + additional bonus payments for every ground truth label they provide.

  2. Paying staff: We will pay staff to recruit, train, and manage volunteers as well as to post-process the data (e.g., insights, anonymization).

  3. Paying for cloud services: We may incur some fees when transmitting the data to Backers.


Goals

Our goal of $15,000 will allow us to:
  • Collect 5-10+ examples per volunteer for each of 5 Backer-selected ground truth labels
  • Guarantee smartwatch (in addition to smartphone) data for 3 or more labels
  • Collect, anonymize, and share 30 days of data from 30 volunteers
  • Collect Demographics, Place, and Contact labels
  • Share code samples
  • Share educational materials including the basic CrowdSignals.io app
  • Create the CrowdSignals.io community profile pages and blog

Risks & Challenges

We're confident that we'll achieve the funding needed to collect an excellent dataset. There are a few risks and challenges which we address here:

  • A lack of volunteers with smartwatches
    In this case we'll recruit additional volunteers and collect ground truth labels in a scripted fashion using smartwatches we provide.


FAQ

  1. How will I receive my Data?
       First, you will fill out an online application that asks for your name, group, institution, use of the data, and other details. Then you will consent to an online license agreement after which we will transfer the data to you via an online storage service such as Google Drive.

  2. I want to support the campaign, but I don't need any data or other Perks, how can I help?
       Please see the section titled Direct Contribution in the How To Contribute + Perks area.

We'll fill this out as we receive more questions from Backers. For now, please read the FAQ on our website: http://CrowdSignals.io/#faq

About AlgoSnap

   AlgoSnap is a bootstrapped start-up in Seattle that offers a platform and services that accelerate the creation of intelligent algorithms for Internet of Things devices and services. AlgoSnap is the entity to which all agreements with CrowdSignals.io Backers and Volunteers will refer. The system that securely collects, anonymizes, stores, and maintains the data during collection is built and maintained by AlgoSnap. AlgoSnap receives advising from a global panel of experts in different areas such as privacy, data transparency, and ethical data collection as well as from a major Silicon Valley law firm with world-class specialists in data privacy law.
  
   AlgoSnap Founder and CEO Evan Welbourne has worked at the intersection of context-awareness, privacy, and data management for mobile, ubiquitous, and sensor systems since the early 2000s. He led the Device Intelligence Group at Samsung Research where his team applied core expertise in context, machine learning, mobility, and predictive analytics to deliver intelligent, personalized user experiences for Samsung's Android and Tizen products. At Nokia, he designed and built the Symbian, Meego, and Android software for the Simple Context system which was used in the Lausanne Data Collection Campaign - one of the largest longitudinal mobile data collection campaigns to date. He has published 20+ papers and holds 15+ patents. He previously managed the Computer Vision Research Group at Amazon, worked for Microsoft Research and Intel Research, and holds a Ph.D. from University of Washington, CSE.

story:
We love nature and combining it with technology is what we are all about. This is why we have created WOCH, which combines the newest technology with the simplicity of nature.

 

 

 

 

 

WOCH is beautifully hand crafted with carefully selected wood, which makes every WOCH unique and special, just as a product like this should be.  

 

And why is WOCH made from wood? Well simply because technology should be more friendly to use and because we think it should be made of us and environment friendly materials. And of course because it looks cool!

 

WOCH works with all QI compatible devices. Most new phones already have built in QI receiver, but if you have an iPhone or other phone without QI receiver, don't worry. You can simply just put QI receiver behind your case. It's so thin, that you won't even notice it. Or better yet, use QI phone case.

You can order QI receiver or QI case with WOCH so you don't need to worry about anything.

 

Customize WOCH and make it perfect just for yourself. You can choose between oak or beech wood and black or white cable. 

 

  • Output: up to 5 W power transfer to the receiver (max: 5V, 1A)
  • Current limit and over-temperature protection
  • 1 m (39 inch) long cable with USB connector

 

Check the variety of rewards we offer below. If you have any questions or a special request please let us know. We love talking to you!

We can`t wait to start making WOCH, so you can try it out too. We already have everything planned, so you don't need to worry about anything.

This campaign wouldn't be possible without the great people who worked really hard, to make it happen. It has been a great pleasure working and creating with: Lenart and Lovro Megusar-photography and video; Meta Mohoric-actress; Rok Gerbec-actor; Tina Pretnar-video voice; Zan Kramar-advertising executive and Andrej Mohoric-video production, photos editing and co-founder.

THANK YOU !

Anze Kozjek, Founder
